channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: PU-EdgeFormer: Edge Transformer for Dense Prediction in Point Cloud Upsampling
item.description: We employ graph convolution using EdgeConv, which learns the local geometry and global structure of point cloud better than existing point-to-feature method.

item.title: Optimizing Guided Traversal for Fast Learned Sparse Retrieval
item.description: Recent studies show that BM25-driven dynamic index skipping can greatly accelerate MaxScore-based document retrieval based on the learned sparse representation derived by DeepImpact.

item.title: Prompt as Triggers for Backdoor Attack: Examining the Vulnerability in Language Models
item.description: Our method does not require external triggers and ensures correct labeling of poisoned samples, improving the stealthy nature of the backdoor attack.

item.title: Long-Tailed Recognition by Mutual Information Maximization between Latent Features and Ground-Truth Labels
item.description: Although contrastive learning methods have shown prevailing performance on a variety of representation learning tasks, they encounter difficulty when the training dataset is long-tailed.

item.title: Complex Logical Reasoning over Knowledge Graphs using Large Language Models
item.description: Reasoning over knowledge graphs (KGs) is a challenging task that requires a deep understanding of the complex relationships between entities and the underlying logic of their relations.

item.title: Memory of recurrent networks: Do we compute it right?
item.description: Numerical evaluations of the memory capacity (MC) of recurrent neural networks reported in the literature often contradict well-established theoretical bounds.

item.title: Transfer Visual Prompt Generator across LLMs
item.description: While developing a new vision-language LLM (VL-LLM) by pre-training on tremendous image-text pairs from scratch can be exceedingly resource-consuming, connecting an existing LLM with a comparatively lightweight visual prompt generator (VPG) becomes a feasible paradigm.

item.title: Finding Neurons in a Haystack: Case Studies with Sparse Probing
item.description: Despite rapid adoption and deployment of large language models (LLMs), the internal computations of these models remain opaque and poorly understood.

item.title: Generalizing Dataset Distillation via Deep Generative Prior
item.description: Dataset Distillation aims to distill an entire dataset's knowledge into a few synthetic images.

item.title: Accelerating Neural Self-Improvement via Bootstrapping
item.description: Few-shot learning with sequence-processing neural networks (NNs) has recently attracted a new wave of attention in the context of large language models.

item.title: MultiLegalSBD: A Multilingual Legal Sentence Boundary Detection Dataset
item.description: Sentence Boundary Detection (SBD) is one of the foundational building blocks of Natural Language Processing (NLP), with incorrectly split sentences heavily influencing the output quality of downstream tasks.

item.title: ARBEx: Attentive Feature Extraction with Reliability Balancing for Robust Facial Expression Learning
item.description: We also employ learnable anchor points in the embedding space with label distributions and multi-head self-attention mechanism to optimize performance against weak predictions with reliability balancing, which is a strategy that leverages anchor points, attention scores, and confidence values to enhance the resilience of label predictions.

item.title: Interpretable Machine Learning for Science with PySR and SymbolicRegression.jl
item.description: PySR was developed to democratize and popularize symbolic regression for the sciences, and is built on a high-performance distributed back-end, a flexible search algorithm, and interfaces with several deep learning packages.

item.title: Geometric Latent Diffusion Models for 3D Molecule Generation
item.description: Generative models, especially diffusion models (DMs), have achieved promising results for generating feature-rich geometries and advancing foundational science problems such as molecule design.

item.title: Addressing Parameter Choice Issues in Unsupervised Domain Adaptation by Aggregation
item.description: Our method outperforms deep embedded validation (DEV) and importance weighted validation (IWV) on all datasets, setting a new state-of-the-art performance for solving parameter choice issues in unsupervised domain adaptation with theoretical error guarantees.

item.title: Stress and heat flux via automatic differentiation
item.description: Machine-learning potentials provide computationally efficient and accurate approximations of the Born-Oppenheimer potential energy surface.

item.title: How to Unleash the Power of Large Language Models for Few-shot Relation Extraction?
item.description: Scaling language models have revolutionized widespread NLP tasks, yet little comprehensively explored few-shot relation extraction with large language models.

item.title: Stratified Adversarial Robustness with Rejection
item.description: We theoretically analyze the stratified rejection setting and propose a novel defense method -- Adversarial Training with Consistent Prediction-based Rejection (CPR) -- for building a robust selective classifier.

item.title: Faster OreFSDet : A Lightweight and Effective Few-shot Object Detector for Ore Images
item.description: For the ore particle size detection, obtaining a sizable amount of high-quality ore labeled data is time-consuming and expensive.

item.title: PGrad: Learning Principal Gradients For Domain Generalization
item.description: In this work, we develop a novel DG training strategy, we call PGrad, to learn a robust gradient direction, improving models' generalization ability on unseen domains.

item.title: Open-ended search for environments and adapted agents using MAP-Elites
item.description: We want to move one step closer to creating simulated environments similar to the diverse real world, where agents can both find solvable tasks, and adapt to them.

item.title: Understanding the Generalization Ability of Deep Learning Algorithms: A Kernelized Renyi's Entropy Perspective
item.description: However, the current generalization error bounds within this framework are still far from optimal, while substantial improvements on these bounds are quite challenging due to the intractability of high-dimensional information quantities.

item.title: Multimodal Neural Databases
item.description: The rise in loosely-structured data available through text, images, and other modalities has called for new ways of querying them.

item.title: Pick-a-Pic: An Open Dataset of User Preferences for Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Using this web app we build Pick-a-Pic, a large, open dataset of text-to-image prompts and real users' preferences over generated images.

item.title: Self-similarity-based super-resolution of photoacoustic angiography from hand-drawn doodles
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose a novel approach that employs a super-resolution PAA method trained with forged PAA images.

item.title: On Uni-Modal Feature Learning in Supervised Multi-Modal Learning
item.description: We abstract the features~(\textit{i. e.} learned representations) of multi-modal data into 1)~\emph{uni-modal features}, which can be learned from uni-modal training, and 2) \emph{paired features}, which can \emph{only} be learned from cross-modal interactions.

item.title: Scalable Mask Annotation for Video Text Spotting
item.description: Video text spotting refers to localizing, recognizing, and tracking textual elements such as captions, logos, license plates, signs, and other forms of text within consecutive video frames.

item.title: Oil Spill Segmentation using Deep Encoder-Decoder models
item.description: Even though oil spills are in and themselves difficult to clean up, the first and foremost challenge is to detect spills.

item.title: Unlimiformer: Long-Range Transformers with Unlimited Length Input
item.description: This way, we can index extremely long input sequences, while every attention head in every decoder layer retrieves its top-$k$ keys, instead of attending to every key.

item.title: RT-K-Net: Revisiting K-Net for Real-Time Panoptic Segmentation
item.description: Our resulting RT-K-Net sets a new state-of-the-art performance for real-time panoptic segmentation methods on the Cityscapes dataset and shows promising results on the challenging Mapillary Vistas dataset.

item.title: FCA: Taming Long-tailed Federated Medical Image Classification by Classifier Anchoring
item.description: To overcome this, we propose federated classifier anchoring (FCA) by adding a personalized classifier at each client to guide and debias the federated model through consistency learning.

item.title: Strengthening structural baselines for graph classification using Local Topological Profile
item.description: We present the analysis of the topological graph descriptor Local Degree Profile (LDP), which forms a widely used structural baseline for graph classification.

item.title: Cross-Institutional Transfer Learning for Educational Models: Implications for Model Performance, Fairness, and Equity
item.description: We also find that stacked ensembling provides no additional benefits to overall performance or fairness compared to either a local model or the zero-shot transfer procedure we tested.

item.title: Improving Rating Prediction in Multi-Criteria Recommender Systems via a Collective Factor Model
item.description: Experiments on three real-world datasets show that our proposed architecture achieves up to 13. 14% lower prediction error over baseline approaches.

item.title: Part Aware Contrastive Learning for Self-Supervised Action Recognition
item.description: This paper proposes an attention-based contrastive learning framework for skeleton representation learning, called SkeAttnCLR, which integrates local similarity and global features for skeleton-based action representations.

item.title: Leveraging Language Representation for Material Recommendation, Ranking, and Exploration
item.description: Data-driven approaches for material discovery and design have been accelerated by emerging efforts in machine learning.

item.title: In-Context Learning Unlocked for Diffusion Models
item.description: To achieve this, we propose a vision-language prompt that can model a wide range of vision-language tasks and a diffusion model that takes it as input.

item.title: Towards the Flatter Landscape and Better Generalization in Federated Learning under Client-level Differential Privacy
item.description: To defend the inference attacks and mitigate the sensitive information leakages in Federated Learning (FL), client-level Differentially Private FL (DPFL) is the de-facto standard for privacy protection by clipping local updates and adding random noise.

item.title: SelfDocSeg: A Self-Supervised vision-based Approach towards Document Segmentation
item.description: Document layout analysis is a known problem to the documents research community and has been vastly explored yielding a multitude of solutions ranging from text mining, and recognition to graph-based representation, visual feature extraction, etc.

item.title: Model-agnostic Measure of Generalization Difficulty
item.description: The measure of a machine learning algorithm is the difficulty of the tasks it can perform, and sufficiently difficult tasks are critical drivers of strong machine learning models.

item.title: ISAAC Newton: Input-based Approximate Curvature for Newton's Method
item.description: We present ISAAC (Input-baSed ApproximAte Curvature), a novel method that conditions the gradient using selected second-order information and has an asymptotically vanishing computational overhead, assuming a batch size smaller than the number of neurons.

item.title: ZeroSearch: Local Image Search from Text with Zero Shot Learning
item.description: The algorithm's output is a list of images sorted in descending order of similarity, helping users to locate specific images more efficiently.

item.title: LooPy: A Research-Friendly Mix Framework for Music Information Retrieval on Electronic Dance Music
item.description: Music information retrieval (MIR) has gone through an explosive development with the advancement of deep learning in recent years.

item.title: Efficient Edge Inference by Selective Query
item.description: Training a hybrid learner is difficult since we lack annotations of hard edge-examples.

item.title: Meat Freshness Prediction
item.description: In most retail stores, the number of days since initial processing is used as a proxy for estimating the freshness of perishable foods or freshness is assessed manually by an employee.

item.title: Boosting Weakly-Supervised Temporal Action Localization with Text Information
item.description: For the discriminative objective, we propose a Text-Segment Mining (TSM) mechanism, which constructs a text description based on the action class label, and regards the text as the query to mine all class-related segments.

item.title: SafeWebUH at SemEval-2023 Task 11: Learning Annotator Disagreement in Derogatory Text: Comparison of Direct Training vs Aggregation
item.description: Subjectivity and difference of opinion are key social phenomena, and it is crucial to take these into account in the annotation and detection process of derogatory textual content.

item.title: Variational Inference for Bayesian Neural Networks under Model and Parameter Uncertainty
item.description: Bayesian neural networks (BNNs) have recently regained a significant amount of attention in the deep learning community due to the development of scalable approximate Bayesian inference techniques.

item.title: Bidirectional Copy-Paste for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In semi-supervised medical image segmentation, there exist empirical mismatch problems between labeled and unlabeled data distribution.

item.title: Poisoning Language Models During Instruction Tuning
item.description: In this work, we show that adversaries can contribute poison examples to these datasets, allowing them to manipulate model predictions whenever a desired trigger phrase appears in the input.
